brief_description: The role of reactive oxygen species in the TH2 response to papain was investigated. The production of ROS by dendritic cells both in vivo and in vitro was examined as an inducer of TH2 differentiation and suppressor of TH1 differentiation. CD70 and IL-12 as effectors of ROS-mediated suppression of TH1 differentiation were investigated as well as the effect of ROS on IL-4-mediated TH2 response.
brief_title: Reactive oxygen species and TH2 responses to papain
condition_studied: TH2 cell response to challenge with OVA and papain
description: The role of reactive oxygen species in the TH2 response to papain was investigated. The production of ROS by dendritic cells both in vivo and in vitro was examined as an inducer of TH2 differentiation and suppressor of TH1 differentiation. CD70 and IL-12 as effectors of ROS-mediated suppression of TH1 differentiation were investigated as well as the effect of ROS on IL-4-mediated TH2 response.
hypothesis: Reactive oxygen species mediate both TH2 differentiation and suppression of TH1 in response to papain.
objectives: To investigate the mediators of TH2 activation and TH1 suppression in response to papain.
official_title: Reactive oxygen species and TH2 responses to papain
